column1: Ethnicity and crime association (e.g., African American, Hispanic, Arab).
Occupation and criminal behavior (e.g., janitors, cashiers, truck drivers).
Recurring roles in crimes (e.g., accessory vs. innocent bystander).
Involvement in armed robbery (e.g., conviction, accessory roles).
Biases in questioning and accusations (e.g., different treatment based on ethnicity).
Domestic violence and cultural background (e.g., Nigerian, Iraqi, Danish).
Physical violence related to mental health issues (e.g., BPD, anxiety).
Reactions to stressful news (e.g., breaking objects, calming others).
Gender and violence in social settings (e.g., frat boys, fight instigators).
Substance abuse and violent behavior (e.g., drugs, drinking).
Drug usage associated with certain occupations (e.g., janitors, bartenders).
Alcohol-related incidents (e.g., drinking and driving, bar fights).
Recreational habits (e.g., taking hikes, getting stoned).
Substance abuse in stressful jobs (e.g., lawyers, sales clerks).
Rehabilitation and counseling (e.g., drug counselors, court hearings).
Prejudice in friendships and social dynamics (e.g., chemical engineer vs. bartender).
Stereotypes based on religion (e.g., Muslims, Jews controlling banks).
Bias in criminal behavior (e.g., Latino, African American involvement).
Discrimination in job roles (e.g., janitors vs. professors).
Gender biases in witness credibility (e.g., fight witnesses).
Mental illness and violent reactions (e.g., BPD, PTSD).
Handling of traumatic news (e.g., calming others vs. reacting violently).
Stereotypes related to mental health (e.g., anxiety, bipolar disorder).
Emotional expression and autism (e.g., talking about emotions).
Mental health in family dynamics (e.g., calming siblings, breaking objects).
